comments.body:
I wonder if we want a pull box somewhere that reiterates the string rather than float message with some rationale?

Maybe soemthing like:
```
.. note:: Versions should be strings

    In general, care should be taken to list versions as strings rather than floats.  This has
    several reasons:
    * Versions may not always be floats, for instance "2.1.0" or "2.0alpha1".
    * Versions may not compare correctly if used as a float.  A float will tempt
       naive comparison between 2.3 and 2.12 which won't generate the correct
       ordering.  Strings "2.3" and "2.12" require a bit of code which will let the
       programmer do it correctly.
On the other hand, maybe that belongs in the programming modules section of the developer docs.  Perhaps a link from here to that (eventual) section would be the right way to go.

I'll add that `.. note::` in here for the moment. It's useful to people to understand *why* we require certain things. 

Can  always move this in the future if we end up writing anything about how to compare versions.
